page.title: 11FARMING
page.content: One local farm which is typical of the area covers 325 acres. It is a mixed farm with pigs, cattle and crops such as barley, oil-seed rape, peas and wheat. Grass is grown to make silage for winter feeding the 74 cows. The barley is used to feed the pigs and some of the wheat is sold to a local dog biscuit factory. The peas are grown under contract to a frozen food company who have a processing factory in Grimsby. Cooking oil is obtained from the seeds of the rape plant. Machinery plays a large part in the running of the farm, where there are 9 tractors, one of them is 30 years old! The 340 year old farm has amongst its 15 buildings, 4 corn sheds, a machinery store, cow sheds and a piggery.
